headline.main: NEW BURMA FRONT ON SALWEEN RIVER; British Try to Hold Line Above Moulmein -- Foe Advances to Attempt Crossing CHURCHILL IN RADIO TALK Chungking Papers Urge That Chinese Units Be Thrown In Against Japanese and Thai

lead_paragraph: RANGOON, Burma, Feb. 1 (U.P.) -- Japanese invaders of Burma tonight were reported attempting to bridge the broad Salween River north of Moulmein, continuing an offensive that now seems aimed directly at this gateway to the Burma Road, 150 miles northwest of Moulmein.
